prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information in Historical Context

para.paratext: Most commercial legal disputes have to do with wealth. Wealth has been equated at various times in history with labour, land, goods for trade, machinery and more recently information. Legal systems have created doctrines to ensure that society maintains a proper balance between the supply and demand for wealth so that economic growth is encouraged. When the basis of societal wealth changes, legal doctrines evolve to recognize and protect that source of wealth.[1]

Intellectual property law regulates the exploitation of ideas, creations or information. The laws of intellectual property rest on the assumption that the original labour of the inventor and the author ought, as a matter of justice and public policy, to be secure against unauthorized use by another. The protection of confidential business information is one of the primary methods that the law has developed to accomplish that task.

The concept of intellectual property dates back to at least 2100 B.C. The Hammurabic Code, the oldest code of written laws, provided for the loss of an eye to one caught prying into forbidden secrets.Link to highlights
